required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Extension Study Of Tanezumab In Osteoarthritis
clinical_study.official_title: A PHASE 3, MULTICENTER, RANDOMIZED, LONG TERM STUDY OF THE SAFETY OF TANEZUMAB IN PATIENTS WITH OSTEOARTHRITIS OF THE KNEE OR HIP

brief_summary.textblock: Safety extension study of Phase 3 Osteoarthritis trials with Tanezumab

detailed_description.textblock: This study was terminated on 27 October 2010 following a US FDA clinical hold for tanezumab osteoarthritis clinical studies which halted dosing and enrollment of patients on 23 June 2010 for potential safety issues.

clinical_study.why_stopped: See termination reason in detailed description.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Must have participated in previous (specific) Phase 3 trials of Tanezumab in osteoarthritis
Exclusion Criteria:
- Willing to comply with scheduled visits and treatment plan Is medically fit to participate in the trial in the judgement of the Investigator

patient_data.ipd_description: Pfizer will provide access to individual de-identified participant data and related study documents (e.g. protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP), Clinical Study Report (CSR)) upon request from qualified researchers, and subject to certain criteria, conditions, and exceptions. Further details on Pfizer's data sharing criteria and process for requesting access can be found at: https://www.pfizer.com/science/clinical_trials/trial_data_and_results/data_requests.
